subject: Guarded Optimism
event:
I almost hate to say anything here, for fear of jinxing it... but for what it's worth, the last six weeks or so have been the most productive period I've had on A DANCE WITH DRAGONS in... well... a year at least, maybe several.  In the last three days I've completed three new chapters.  Not from scratch, mind you, these were all chapters that had been partially written, and in some cases rewritten, for months if not years.  But they're finally done, and I've just reread them, and I'm almost convinced that they're Not Crap.  

We'll see how I feel tomorrow.

Anyway, I know I don't talk about DANCE frequently here, and that's not going to change.  Sorry, but I'm never going to be one of these writers who blogs daily about how many words they produced today.  I don't like to talk about the good days for fear of jinxing myself (all writers are superstitious at heart, just like baseball players), and I don't like to talk about the bad days... well, just because.  Writing is like sausage making in my view; you'll all be happier in the end if you just eat the final product without knowing what's gone into it.

But I am making a small exception now because... well, I'm feeling rather jazzed right now, and for the first time in a very long while, I think I can see a glimmering that might just be a light at the end of the tunnel.

Now if I can only slash through the Meereenese knot that I've been worrying at since 2005, I may actually start to get excited.

comments.article: Great news, boss. Congratulations.

comments.upictitle: Deep down I'm shallow like you.: mmmmmmm.
comments.article: Huzzah!
Yay! That's very exciting, George, keep up the good work!
Congrats George! I am glad to hear that this was a productive month and lets hope that you get more months like these :)
Does this mean your June deadline still stands...? =P
comments.subject: June?

comments.article:
it's already the end of june...

but since winter only comes every what... 20 years in the seven kingdoms i guess we have another 3 years to wait...

i sure hope not but LOL all the same...
comments.subject: Re: June?

comments.article: That's fantastic! Congratulations on breaking through that barrier.
Firefly rocks!

comments.upictitle: Popular series of fiction, fancy, and fact.: This wine was actually awful.
comments.article:
This post has nullified the Pavlovian weep-on-sight response I've developed from reading past entries about DWD progress.

Congrats!

I'm touching wood so that you're not jixing yourself ;)

*is just waiting patiently and began rereading the serie, once again, in English this time XD*
what did you read it in lst time may i ask?
Take your time Mr. Martin, take your time :)
You're gonna give yourself an ulcer.

Encouraging news!  As I'm sure many others also are, I stand ready to purchase a copy and read it with great enthusiasm when it's all wrapped up... and probably reread the series again to get it all fresh in my head beforehand.  Hopefully the writing is, in the end, as much fun for you as the reading is for us.
Mmm, sausage.

Nice to hear you're having a somewhat easier time of it. May it continue. *knock to Odin*

Don't mind us. We may bitch sometimes, but in the end what are we gonna do, not read it? Please.
When in doubt.... add a car chase.

comments.upictitle: Soufflé Girl Wannabe: Saxon - Made of Win
comments.article: That's great news! I hope the good days continue on and on for you. Writer's block is teh suck.
Sending lots of love and happy thoughts your way, then. :) Your jazzed is our jazzed! :D
Hooray!

:D

That's lovely news. ♥
This is exciting news!

Awesome news! My husband, myself and our best friend are so excited we're all re-reading the first books!  I told him I'm waiting until you make the official announcement, because I tend to just sit and read good material in a matter of days and I want everything fresh on my memory!
Many thanks! I like both sausages and good news! :).

It's always encouraging for us mere mortals that the people who are brilliant at what they do sometimes struggle too.

Reach for that light!

I don't like to tell people about good things for fear it might somehow make them less good. Like my own little happy nuggets I save to pull up later when I'm having a bad time at it.

I am glad you said something though. I will knock on wood that it doesn't halt the momentum.

Yay! And your first paragraph made me chuckle. I have the same "almost convinced it's Not Crap." feeling when I get close to finishing a choreography and its actually all working the way I want.
Thanks for the update!

comments.upictitle: Nicknames include: Ahma, GG, Hedgehog, Dodo: BooBah!
comments.article:
Good for you George! Keep on keepin' on! Just do your thing...it's worked so well in the past :D

I am reading The Stand right now (and suffering from pregnancy induced ADD) so I should be busy reading for quite a while. At the slow rate I am going, I might finish it in a year :P

And in November our little guy will be here, so I doubt I'll have time to read ANYTHING then, no matter how much I'm dying to ;) (of course, I'll still buy DRAGONS whenever it comes out though!)
